channel.title: Cannot figure out how to get my client to connect to my no-ip server
channel.description:
I have my no-ip open and the server running.
[IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/t50ioo.jpg[/img]
I changed the server ip in my client.java to my no-ip hosting server.
[IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/mm7h4w.jpg[/img]
I changed the server ip in my gui.java to my no-ip hosting server also.
Yet I still get this.
[IMG]http://i43.tinypic.com/1hbawz.jpg[/img]
This is my first server and if anyone could help me get this up, it would be greatly appreciated. Thank you. :)

item.title: Cannot figure out how to get my client to connect to my no-ip server
item.dc:creator: @dd_cl_a_wz dd cl a wz
item.description:
@dd_cl_a_wz wrote:

go under src and click on server and it should say System.out.println(“Server listening on port 0.0.0.0:” + serverlistenerPort);
and change it to ur ip

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot figure out how to get my client to connect to my no-ip server
item.dc:creator: @dddylan98 dddylan98
item.description:
@dddylan98 wrote:

Error: I could not see your service on 6x.2xx.xxx.xxx on port (43594)
Reason: Connection timed out

I have already created an exception for it in my Firewall and in my Router’s Gateway.

and then go to canyouseeme.org and see if the port is open make sure u have the source running
